solution.text:
We can say the TSA of a Capsule= CSA of cylinder + CSA of the two hemispheres
CSA of a hemisphere is given by \(2 \times \pi \times r^2\)
we have diameter of the hemisphere=_{{k*2}}_=2r\(\Rightarrow \) r=_{k}_
therefore area of a hemisphere=\(2 \times \pi \times _{k}_^2=_{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*k,2)}}_\)
Now area of a cylinder=\(2\times \pi \times r \times h\)
height of the cylinder(h)=\(total\, height\, -\,2r=_{j}_\)
Therefore area of the cylinder=\(2\times \pi \times _{k}_ \times _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*j,2)}}_\)
TSA of a Capsule= CSA of cylinder + CSA of the two hemispheres=\(_{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*j,2)}}_+ 2 \times [_{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*k,2)}}_]\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*j+4*pi_val*k*k,2)}}_\)

content.text:
Find the surface area of a medicine capsule if it's total height is _{{j+k+k}}_cm and diameter is _{{2*k}}_cm
Shape of the capsule is given in the figure
